front.p: 1881 July 12: to Hector Museum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000094/005/0201

body.p: I hope you are quite well. I should like to write you a long note, but as I fear you are very busy (Eng. Mail week) I refrain.—

Just 5 words, however, I must jot down—to accompany enclosed clipping:—from it you will find we have 5 new members (& 4 a little before), and our Council has decided, on my proposal, &c., that I purchase from your store the extra copies required for our new Members:—& so I have written to Mr. Gore for 6 Copies, vol. xiii., please let me have them. I may also add that I quite expect I shall have to apply for more, as I believe there will be several other new members yet: you will see they are nearly all our own “boys”, and (may I write it) my own writings in “Trans.”, re our old Maoris have drawn them out.—
We had a very good meeting last night—good attendance of both sexes, & long at it.
Do you purpose moving this way? I have a lot of nice spns. of Bryozoa, &c., I should much like you to see. Are you too busy to look at them (& name & return) if I send them down? I am, Dear Sir,
